name: Guitar Chord and Scale Diagrammer

screenshots.caption: You can include any characters at any fret (label finger numbers, root notes, intervals, etc.).  Create little chord diagrams, or full fret scale and arpeggio fingerings containing any number of frets.
Layout any number of chords per line, leave empty spaces where needed, create images or HTML layouts which can be quickly emailed or added to a web site.

Create instant HTML or Image layouts of any selected diagrams, which can be easily printed, emailed, uploaded to a web site, etc.  Layout spacing, colors, and other properties can be quickly and easily adjusted.  Creating entire collections of chord diagrams for songs or for specific topics takes just a few seconds.
Diagram creation is FAST.  Just click to select and unselect frets, and type in a label.
Individual diagrams are saved to .png images, so that they can be reused in other layouts.

short_description:
Instantly create customized chord, scale, and arpeggio diagrams of any complexity.  Just point and click to add fingerings and labels.  Print layouts in seconds.

When the program starts, enter the number of frets you want in your diagram.   Click any fret on any string to add a dot (finger position).  Click any added dot to remove it (change it back to an empty position).  Right-Click any fret on any string to add a character of your choice (add finger numbers, root note labels, interval labels, etc.).  Click the title text to give the chord/scale/arpeggio a name.  Right-Click the title to save the diagram to a .png image.  Press the "p" key on your keyboard to create an HTML or Image layout of any selected diagrams you've created.

It's fast, Fast, FAST. Create totally customized collections of chord fingerings in seconds for songs, or for specific topics. Perfect for teachers who don't want to waste lesson time drawing grids.

VIDEO:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VZXlfisNZvM
summary: Quickly create, edit, and print guitar chord/scale fingering diagrams
